sources.title: The Guns of Navarone (1961) Gregory Peck · David Niven
sources.description: Kriegsabenteuer nach Alistair MacLean mit großem Staraufgebot. A British team is sent to cross occupied Greek territory and destroy the massive German gun emplacement commanding a vital sea channel.

sources.title: The Guns of Navarone (1961)
sources.description: The film centers around a group of Allied commandos during World War II who are tasked with a near-impossible mission. The setting is the Greek island of Navarone, which is home to two heavily fortified German coastal guns threatening Allied naval ships. The main goal is to destroy the German guns to ensure the safe passage of Allied ships in the Aegean Sea. The commandos face numerous challenges as they infiltrate the island, including perilous terrain, enemy patrols, and moral dilemmas among the team members. As they navigate the island, personal conflicts arise, further complicating their mission.In a tense climax, the team manages to reach the guns. They engage in a fierce battle to destroy the fortifications. The film concludes with the team successfully completing their mission, but not without significant sacrifice and losses, highlighting the costs of war.

metadata.Plot: In 1943, the British Navy is not able to rescue 2,000 soldiers trapped in the Island of Kheros since two powerful German cannons on the top of the Navarone Island are sinking the Allied vessels. After a failed aerial attack, the Allied command decide to send a six-man team disguised as fishermen to Navarone to blow-up the guns. The squad is commanded by Maj. Roy Franklin and composed by Capt. Keith Mallory, who is an experienced mountain climber, and his former partner Col. Andrea Stavros; the explosive expert Cpl. John Anthony Miller; the engineer CPO 'Butcher' Brown; and the Greek assassin Spyros Pappadimos, who was born in Navarone. They sail during the night and after an encounter with a German patrol boat and a storm in the sea, they arrive to Navarone and Capt. Mallory needs to climb a cliff face during a heavy rainy night to proceed their mission. Will they succeed?
metadata.Actors: David Niven, Gregory Peck, Anthony Quinn
